summary: Email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding a grand jury subpoena issued on July 5, 2019, to an unnamed client. The emails discuss scheduling meetings, providing transcripts and evidence (including cell phone records showing contacts with underage girls), and the possibility of a voluntary interview in lieu of a grand jury appearance.

persons.name: Suzanne Jaffe Bloom
persons.context: Partner at Winston & Strawn LLP representing an unnamed client who received a grand jury subpoena; corresponds with prosecutors to schedule meetings and discuss evidence.

persons.name: Johanna Rae Hudgens
persons.context: Associate at Winston & Strawn LLP working with Suzanne Jaffe Bloom on the grand jury subpoena matter; assists with scheduling and correspondence.

connections.description: Work together at Winston & Strawn LLP on the defense of a client subpoenaed by the SDNY grand jury.
Bloom is formally retained to represent the client in connection with the SDNY grand jury subpoena.

events.title: Grand Jury Subpoena Issued
events.description: SDNY grand jury subpoena issued to an unnamed individual.

events.title: Original Grand Jury Appearance Date
events.description: Initial date the subpoenaed individual was to appear before the grand jury, which was adjourned.

events.title: Proposed Meeting with Prosecutors
events.description: Defense attorneys propose a meeting with prosecutors to discuss the subpoena and evidence.

locations: 200 Park Avenue, New York, NY 10166-4193 (Winston & Strawn LLP office)
keyFacts: Prosecutors possess contemporaneous telephone records, including from a cell phone registered to the unnamed client, showing numerous contacts with multiple underage girls.
The defense and prosecution are negotiating a voluntary interview in lieu of a grand jury appearance, with the appearance date held in abeyance.
The emails reference multiple civil cases related to Jeffrey Epstein, including docket numbers 15 Civ. 7433, 17 Civ. 616, and 08 Civ. 80736.
The client's identity is redacted, but the context suggests they are a person of interest in the SDNY investigation into Epstein's network.
